column2: This character primarily worships the good or neutral deities (Estelar) of the Faerûnian Pantheon.
This character primarily worships the evil deities (or Dark Estelar) of the Faerûnian Pantheon.
This character worships the gods that embody the destructive forces of nature.
This character follows Cyric, the Prince of Lies. Cyric is a newly-risen god who stole his portfolio from other Dark Gods. He is at best a rival, and more often an enemy, to virtually all other gods.

This character follows the Calishite religion, which follows the polytheistic gods of Faerun, although often under different names. This form of the Faerunian faith permits polygamy, and members are sometimes symathetic to the views of the Zakharan faith of Ten Thousand Gods.
This character follows the radical arm of the Church of Chauntea, which believes that as Chauntea personifies the whole earth, so her worship must be spread to all the ends of the world.
This character worships Ubtao, the Creator of Chult. Ubtao is said to be the creator of the land of Chult, founder of the city of Mezro, and father of the land's dinosaurs.
This character worships the ancient alien gods brought to Toril by Ptah long ago.
This character worships the exiled demigods led by the divine hero Gilgeam, former god-king of Unther.

This character follows the ancient Muhjari faith, which was brought to Semphar from Zakhara not long after the time of the Loregiver. The Muhjari faith emphasies right action according to a practical moral code.

This character follows the Path of Enlightenment, a Shou philosophy which emphasises submission to the wisdom of Heaven, as manifested both in the natural order and the Mandate of Heaven upon the Shou emperor.
This character follows the path of Adama, a faith from Var the Golden, which teaches that all beings partake of a single oversoul, itself called the Adama.

This character follows the Padhran faith, which teaches detachment from earthly concerns. It was founded millennia ago by a prince who became known as the Padhra, and is now taught by lamas from the remote land of Ra-Khati.
This character follows the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods, an enlightened faith from Zakhara which honours many gods from all lands.
the Enlightened Law of the Loregiver
the cold gods of the elements
This character worships Loviatar, the Maiden of Pain. She is dedicated to causing suffering, and to those who have not felt the touch of her whip, her faith is often a mystery.
This character worships a powerful demon of the Abyss, perhaps even a Demon Prince.
The Seldarine (Elvish for "fellowship of brothers and sisters of the wood") are the elven pantheon of gods that resided on the astral dominion of Arvandor under the leadership of Corellon Larethian.
Morndinsamman (dwarven: "shield brothers on high" or "high dwarves") is the collective name of the fourteen deities that form the dwarven pantheon.
This character follows the shamanistic faith of the Tuigan. These nomadic tribespeople worship elemental gods and spirits, and have little time for the deities of settled folk.
the angry gods of other nations
The Church of Lolth is solely dedicated to the worship of Lolth, the fearsome spider-demon goddess of the dark elves, or drow.
The Giant Pantheon is worshipped by all kinds of giants across Faerûn. It is headed by Annam, the lofty and unapproachable chief of the giant deities.
all the gods of the Giants
the small gods of the small peoples

The Faceless God is the pitiless deity of the yaklike Yikarians. Said to resemble an immense Yikarian with a totally blank face, the Faceless One demands continual devotion and sacrifice, both of Yikarians and lesser species.

The Drow Pantheon, sometimes called the Dark Seladarine, is a fractious family of gods worshipped by the dark elves, or drow. Their self-appointed chief is their mother, Lolth, but not all of her children respect her iron rule.

Vhaeraun is the drow god of thievery, territory, and shadow magic. He is the second most frequently worshipped drow god after his mother and enemy Lolth, and the most frequently worshipped drow god on the surface. Among the drow pantheon, he held the unique view that males and females were equally valuable.
The gods of the dragons are often referred to as the children of Io, the unthinkably ancient Ninefold Dragon who is said to be the god and parent of all dragonkind, good and evil alike.
the gods of all lesser species
The orc pantheon consists of the various gods of the orcs. They reside on the plane of Nishrek and are led by Gruumsh One-eye.
the gods of the non-Orcish peoples
The goblin pantheon consists of the various gods of the goblins.

The Monster Pantheon is a generic grouping of deities who, although generally not worshipped together, share some common similarities. These deities are usually the sole being worshipped by a race of monsters and are often their creator too.
the multifarious divinities of the monsters of Faerûn
the gods of the civilised species

Uthgar, the Battle Father is the patron demigod of the Uthgardt as well as physical strength. As a mortal, Uthgar was a great barbarian Thane who famously slayed and was slain by Gurt, the Lord of the Pale Giants. In recognition of his prowess, Tempus, Lord of Battles elevated Uthgar to demigodhood and his followers became his first worshippers, calling themselves the Uthgardt after him. It is said that Uthgar had tamed many animal spirits, from which the modern Uthgardt named their tribes after.
